pipeline@27.label: ISO3 country code
pipeline@27.description: ISO3 country code for country of interest. For a list of ISO3 country codes, look [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes).

pipeline@41.label: Polygon of study area
pipeline@41.description: Polygon of the study area, in geopackage format. To use a custom study area, input the path to the file in userdata (e.g. /userdata/study_area_polygon.gpkg) and it will override the country polygon from the "Get country polygon" script.

pipeline@29.label: Polygon of protected areas
pipeline@29.description: The protected areas (PAs) of interest. To combine WDPA data and custom data, add the path to the custom geopkg here "e.g. /userdata/my_protected_areas.gpkg). They will be combined within the script. If you want to use only custom polygons, please use the "ProtConn analysis with custom PAs" pipeline.

pipeline@9.label: Coordinate reference system
pipeline@9.description:
This input specifies the coordinate reference system of the study area polygon and the protected area polygons for the ProtConn calculation. This must be a projected CRS, otherwise the distance calculations will not be accurate.

This numerical value specifies the projection and geodetic datum used to define the coordinates and spatial representation of the data in the study area.

For further information on coordinate systems and EPSG codes, you can access the official database on the EPSG website at [https://epsg.org/home.html](https://epsg.org/home.html).
The website provides documentation, resources, and tools for searching and understanding the EPSG codes used in various geospatial contexts.

data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|status_type.description:
Legal status types of protected areas to include.  

Designated means that it is officially established under national or international law/policy. 

Inscribed means that it is inscribed in an international list (e.g. World Heritage). This can overlap with designated. 

Established means that it is protected and managed, but possibly lacks formal legal desgination.
data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|status_type.label: PA legal status types to include

data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_unesco.description:
Check to include UNESCO Biosphere reserves. These These serve as learning sites for sustainable development and combine biodiversity conservation with the sustainable use of natural resources and sustainable development. 

They may not be legally protected and may not be fully conserved, because they are often used for development or human settlement. Excluding these will limit the dataset to meeting stricter conservation standards.
data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_unesco.label: Exclude UNESCO Biosphere reserves

data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|buffer_points.description:
Buffer protected area points by reported area. Some protected areas are reported as single points rather than polygons.

If checked, this will create a circular protected area around the reported point that is equal to the reported area. Checking this box will not affect the distance calculations if using the protected area centroid because the centroid will be the point, but if using  the distance to edge, it will cause inaccuracies in the protected area connectivity calculations. 

If there is no reported area, it will remove the point. If left unchecked, all protected areas represented as points will be removed.
data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|buffer_points.label: Buffer protected area points

data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_marine.description:
Include marine protected areas or filter them out. Note that the analysis is still limited to the bounds of the study 
area polygon.
data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_marine.label: Include marine protected areas

data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_oecm.description:
Whether to include areas with other effective area-based conservation measures (OECMs). These are not officially designated
protected areas but are still achieving conservation outcomes.
data>cleanWDPA.yml@40|include_oecm.label: Include OECMs

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Name of the column in the user provided protected area file that specifies when the PA was created (leave blank if only using WDPA data).
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Date column name

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description:
Refers to the threshold distance (in meters) used to estimate if the areas are connected in a spatial analysis. This threshold represents the median dispersal probability (i.e. where the dispersal probability between patches is 0.5). Dispersal probability is calculated with an exponential decay function with increasing distance.

Common dispersal distances that encompass many different taxa are 1000 meters, 10,000 meters, and 100,000 meters. 

Note that the more distances you include, the longer the pipeline will take to complete and the more memory it will require. Additionally, larger dispersal distances will be more computationally intensive.
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Distance analysis threshold

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Type of distance matrix to use in the ProtConn calculation. The "centroid" option will measure the distances between protected areas from from the geometric center of each protected area, while the "edge" option will measure the distance as the nearest edge between two protected areas.
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Type of distance matrix

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Year for which you want ProtConn calculated (e.g. an input of 2000 will calculate ProtConn for only PAs that were designated before the year 2000)
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Year for cutoff

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Year for the time series plot to start
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Start year

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Year interval for the time series plot of ProtConn values (e.g. an input of 20 will calculate ProtConn for every 20 years by filtering out protected areas established before that year)
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Year interval

data>getCountryPolygon.yml@5|country_pol.description: Polygon of the chosen country or region in the crs of choice in geopackage format.
data>getCountryPolygon.yml@5|country_pol.label: Polygon of country or region

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Protected areas on which ProtConn is being calculated. Overlapping protected areas have been merged into one to speed up calculation.
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: Protected areas

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: The results of the ProtConn calculations, including the percentage of the study area that is unprotected and protected, and the percentage that is protected and connected (ProtConn) and protected and unconnected (ProtUnconn).
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: ProtConn results

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Donut plot of the percentage of total area that is unprotected, protected and connected, and protected and unconnected for each input dispersal distance (in meters).
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: ProtConn result plot

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Table of the time series of ProtConn and ProtUnconn values, calculated at the time interval that is specified.
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: ProtConn time series results

protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.description: Change in the percentage area that is protected and the percentage that is protected and connected over time, at the chosen time interval, compared to the Kunming-Montreal GBF goals.
protconn_analysis>protconn_analysis.yml@.label: ProtConn time series plot

metadata.name: ProtConn Analysis with WDPA
metadata.description: This pipeline calculates ProtConn (Protected Connected Index) from protected area polygons using data pulled from the World Database of Protected Areas through their API. The user can also combine WDPA data with user-input data. To run the analysis on user-input data only,  see the "ProtConn analysis with custom PAs" pipeline. The pipeline uses the MK_Protconn function in the Makurhini package to calculate the percentage of the study area that is protected and connected, based on median dispersal distances and the distance between protected areas.
